articles.headline: In Price War, E-Readers Go Below $200
articles.snippet: Barnes & Noble said it would drop the price of the Nook to $199. Responding rapidly, Amazon.com cut the price of its popular Kindle e-reader below the Nook, to $189.
articles.abstract: Barnes & Noble said it would drop the price of the Nook to $199. Responding rapidly, Amazon.com cut the price of its popular Kindle e-reader below the Nook, to $189.
articles.lead_paragraph: A price war is brewing in the growing market for electronic reading devices.

articles.headline: Battles in California Over Mortgages
articles.snippet: The California Assembly will take up a bill that would redefine the obligations of many defaulting homeowners.
articles.abstract: The California Assembly will take up a bill that would redefine the obligations of many defaulting homeowners.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the housing market continues to sputter, the real estate industry is increasingly split on the responsibilities of overextended and foreclosed homeowners.

articles.headline: A Health Insurer Pays More to Save
articles.snippet: By paying for nurses to track the sickest patients, Geisinger experienced a 23 percent drop in hospital admissions.
articles.abstract: By paying for nurses to track the sickest patients, Geisinger experienced a 23 percent drop in hospital admissions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like a lot of doctors, Patrick Kilduff has too many patients and too little time. He and the five other physicians in Shavertown, Pa., oversee the care of about 12,000 people, and a typical office visit lasts just 15 minutes.

articles.headline: Diamond Find Could Aid Zimbabwe, and Mugabe
articles.snippet: New mining has provoked fears that riches will be used to subvert attempts to bring democracy to Zimbabwe.
articles.abstract: New mining has provoked fears that riches will be used to subvert attempts to bring democracy to Zimbabwe.
articles.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG  New mining in Zimbabwe has quickly yielded millions of carats of diamonds and could help catapult the nation into the ranks of the world’s top diamond producers, according to the head of a group of experts for the United Nations-backed effort to stop the trade in conflict diamonds.

articles.headline: In Law Schools, Grades Go Up, Just Like That
articles.snippet: In the last two years, at least 10 law schools have made their grading systems more lenient to give their students a better chance in a soft job market.
articles.abstract: In the last two years, at least 10 law schools have made their grading systems more lenient to give their students a better chance in a soft job market.
articles.lead_paragraph: One day next month every student at Loyola Law School Los Angeles will awake to a higher grade point average.

articles.headline: Elon Musk, PayPal Pioneer, Is Paper-Rich, Cash-Poor
articles.snippet: Elon Musk, a serial entrepreneur who has made several fortunes, co-founded PayPal and is chairman of Tesla Motors, says he has no cash.
articles.abstract: Elon Musk, a serial entrepreneur who has made several fortunes, co-founded PayPal and is chairman of Tesla Motors, says he has no cash.
articles.lead_paragraph: The funny thing about Elon Musk is that he does  sort of remind you of Tony Stark. Minus the Iron Man suit.

articles.headline: Exporters Optimistic Over Move on Currency
articles.snippet: Trade experts say that companies that export to China will benefit, while discount importers that rely on China may not.
articles.abstract: Trade experts say that companies that export to China will benefit, while discount importers that rely on China may not.
articles.lead_paragraph: Embracing China’s decision to let its currency move more freely, American businesses said on Monday that the move would make it easier to compete against Chinese companies and would help reduce the United States trade deficit.
articles.byline: By Steven Greenhouse and Stephanie Clifford

articles.headline: McCain Is Now Running Just to Stay in Place
articles.snippet: Gone are the days when John McCain drew big crowds as he battled for the presidency. Now he is just trying to keep his job.
articles.abstract: Gone are the days when John McCain drew big crowds as he battled for the presidency. Now he is just trying to keep his job.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARKER, Ariz. — He still tells the story about the call he got at 2 a.m. from the woman in Chandler who was upset about changes in her garbage pick up, and the ossified joke concerning two Irish brothers (“The only ethnic group in America you can still joke about”) boozed up at a bar.

articles.headline: Britain Unveils Emergency Budget
articles.snippet: The budget calls for Britain’s deepest fiscal retrenchment since the early years of Margaret Thatcher’s rule.
articles.abstract: The budget calls for Britain’s deepest fiscal retrenchment since the early years of Margaret Thatcher’s rule.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON  Chancellor of the Exchequer George Osborne unveiled a sweeping emergency budget on Tuesday combining severe spending cuts and some tax increases in Britain’s deepest fiscal retrenchment since the early years of Margaret Thatcher’s rule.
articles.byline: By Landon Thomas Jr. and Alan Cowell

articles.headline:
McChrystal’s Fate in Limbo 
as He Prepares to Meet Obama
articles.snippet: President Obama said that Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal had shown “poor judgment” after his remarks in a magazine profile, and Pentagon officials said that the general had prepared a letter of resignation.
articles.abstract: President Obama said that Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal had shown “poor judgment” after his remarks in a magazine profile, and Pentagon officials said that the general had prepared a letter of resignation.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by Helene Cooper, Thom Shanker and Dexter Filkins.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper, Thom Shanker and Dexter Filkins
